description:
Not very comforting when messing with the kernel.
"Canonical Livepatch has experienced an internal error. Please refer to https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Kernel/Livepatch#CommonIssues for further information." offers no specific things to do remedy the problem.
summary: An error occured when checking for Livepatch updates

description:
ubuntu fan.
i love it

First off, I'd like to express that as software and project the sucess of snap has allow it to make its way into some of the common day to day OSs. Rating of 3 not due to lack of functionality of bad development, but for much more deep reasons...

 For the first time since using Linux (some 15+ years now) I feel like the "assurance" we all had in the Linux community started to crack with snap. 

In the past, I viewed any linux box that was tuned proprtly to NEVER have a process(s) in the background sending telemetry data about me....unless they were telemetry programs I wrote myself...big difference

...privacy, and full control of our devices is a battle that we appear to be losing. At least some distros feel the same way still and have opted to completely exclude snap.
Its is very helpful.
good to know it exist, chaos and confusion snap created as second fiddle parallel to apt stepping on each other toes, don't know which version installed and get updated

All I can see from this app and snap store and there permissions is just like Google and Facebook they want your personal information and the most important part which are the applications and making sure they work flawless are less important to a point that any application I install from snap crashes, unable to install, buggy or incomplete packges and they wonder why so many people started to hate Ubuntu well this is one reason! it seems the Linux is going to the same direction as microsoft windows and Apple, what a shame!
Stop forcing Ubuntu users to use this.
summary: Stop forcing us to use this

description: This shouldnt even be included
You do not care about the customer. You care only of making money through manipulation and exploitation of our privacy. Big thumbs down, hoss.
summary: WHY? Oh, to sell our privacy to the highest bidder. Garbage

description:
Bloat, bloat and more bloat. 

Here's an idea Ubuntu users, if you don't like snapd, don't use this POS of and OS.
works really good
It's great because you can add more to linux without the hassle of using the terminal.
it makes installing/updating apps a lot easier
amazing app uts tge bs t ever
crashes other installs
THis is why i hate ubuntu, this service runs in the background always, even though no one uses snaps, everyone is realiant on apt, please take this out
unnecessary and hard to remove

I like snaps. I am in the minority of people who think snaps are better than flatpaks. I think so for lots of reasons, here's one: you dont need root privileges to install/ change.

The only thing making this not 5/5 is that Canonical is forcing it into Ubuntu. It shouldn't be like that at all, people should choose to install a universal packaging format if they need it.

It is really great.

description:
I have used snaps and thought a good way to install softwares. But there are issues like:
 - permission
 - high cpu consumptions for some apps like VS Code (Note: I have noticed low CPU consuption of VS Code when installed deb and removed snapd)

I am facing these issues since I am using Snapd on my Ubuntu 20.04 and on ubuntu 22.04 I am facing same issue.
So going to completely uninstall these snaps ans snap store.
summary: Not a good experience with Snaps

description:
Canonical has become the Google of the Linux world, by forcing us to use snaps. It makes Ubuntu bloated and lots of snaps are proprietary or commercial software. We cannot uninstall it or set permissions.
If you're still holding on to Ubuntu, like me, in the mere hope that it might become the great OS that it used to be, you might want to get get flatpak, which the creator of Ubuntu says is 'not secure', but it is perfectly secure and much more efficient than snap. The course Ubuntu has taken in the last 5 years is comparable to how bad Windows has become from Windows 8.
And now the Ubuntu logo has ironically become the Windows 8 share icon...
Why should I use snaps when I can just use apt? apt is easier and less complicated.
Need some improvements but are realy good and they are working on improvements

Almost ... 

Now app not update until will be closed but still not validation to required size for download (for slow network connections)
juytc vbtyrfgyu
dddf;fffllffllg

I am quite new to linux willing to learn, uninstalled Windows 7 and installed Ubuntu, then the latest update and I do not have any browsers that will let me onto the internet, I know im connected as I can ping websites.

I have tried unintalling and reintalling Firefox & Opera nothing, I have used the terminal to check and it's there will not do anything, even Spotify doesn't work. Gone through all the help topics, even used my laptop to view videos just in case that helped, tried all the snapd command and nothing.

But what really gets me is I will have to use windows machine to download a Linux distro as this update will not let me near the download or any other site

description: deb is faster and smaller, I hope user can choose what package they use ! There are so many people want to install firefox through apt not snap by default
Terrible. Slower to launch everything. How did this ever become a thing?!?
Packages are unstable, other tools fail to interface with snap packages properly, and moreover it is FORCED. We are so far from the philosophy of FOSS.
Takes up too much space on the drive and it's a pain to reclaim it.
This is what you need, when you want to convert your machine into a terminal for tangible reward.
the app d'ont eraseble me i use ubuntu softare app

Only allows installation of Snap packages. Overides apt. I use a theatrical lighting control software (QLC+) and Snap will only allow the approved version which is not the newest version. Bug fixes and fixture definitions be darned. 

I'm migrating everything to Mint. I understand why they created Snap, but it sucks and is culty like Microsoft, Apple, Google, and Samsung. I was trying to get away from all of that when I started using Ubuntu.

Ubuntu was my go to distro. It was the one I got non-linux users to actually use linux. Now because Cannonical thinks they know better than the user and that they can "win" the package manager race by locking out user choice and increasing their control over the user by imposing an unwanted and unneeded solution, I am done with it. This was written from the last Ubuntu machine I have. There will soon be none.
summary: Complexity for reasons because users don't know what they need

Snaps handle sandboxing like flatpak, it's great- it keeps my folders nice and clean from random software clutter. what it does better than flatpak is organizing what happens inside of it better- the stuff it installs is all neatly packaged inside the snap folder in my home directory

I do not trust snap at all. It's the first time I've had Firefox crash from removing a USB hub device, and had it crash had it crash my graphical shell and freeze my system by trying to remove Firefox.

description:
Die zahlreichen Anwendungen, die auf Snap aufsetzen, sind einfach nur abgründig in der Anwendung! Es ist erkennbar, dass jemand (Canonical...?) versucht, aus Linux das zu machen, was Windows schlecht macht: Seine Neigung, Menschen nicht nur Werkzeuge zur Steigerung der Produktivität zu geben, sondern ihm möglichst vollständig das eigene Denken abzugewöhnen (was dann ja - vergleichbar zu Microsoft bei Windows) vom Konzern (=Canonical) übernommen würde.
Linux war und ist an Menschen gerichtet, die selbst denken - und so soll das auch bitte bleiben! Wenn Canonical das so haben will, dann soll man dort bitte einkomplettes eigenes System vertreiben und es auch nicht länger Linux nennen - denn e s  i s t  k e i n Linux mehr unter solchen Umständen... sondern allenfalls - wie gesagt - Ubuntows von Canosoft... 
schwach, schwach, so etwas sagen zu können!
Ich werde - wie ich Zeit finde - diese Entmündigung und Denksurrogat aus Ubuntu entfernen!
summary: Linux darf nicht zu Lionows werden !

description:

All it's missing now are BSODs for a proper Windows experience ;)

Snap is awful. It starts by sandboxing applications… then realize that applications needs to communicate with other applications. So you add bridges to communicate… ruining the point of sandboxing an application.
So it basically does nothing more than a regular package manager, but it adds complexity to the process. Apps are way bigger because now they ship their dependancies and are much slower.
Correction, Snap does less than a regular package manager.
It sucks, drop it.

description: Une fois passé sur Ubuntu 22.04.1 les mises à jour sont impossibles, à moins que l'on me dise comment faire...
sand box inutile et rajoute encore des couhes
accapare beaucoup de ressources contre peu de contrepartie
J'ai bien vu les inconvénients, par contre pour l'instant j'attends encore de voir les avantages. Changement de distribution en vue ...

L'utilisation de Snap permet non seulement de cloisonner le système, mais aussi de faciliter les mises à jour des applications. Du point de vue de la sécurité, associé à AppArmor, snap apporte une réelle amélioration. Ubuntu est sur la bonne voie et j'espère même que les devs iront au bout de la démarche por construire une distribution vraiment solide :-)

Snap fait exploser le poid des applications et fait ralentir le système, et j'attends toujours de voir un avantage à ce truc. Ça ne sert à rien à part consommer des ressources !
